title: Dollywood Closes Amid Tennessee Storm, Visitors Seek Ticket Refunds | Times Now
text: Dolly Parton's theme park in Tennessee - Dollywood - closed on Wednesday (May 8) due to severe weather, amidst tornados and thunderstorm in the state. The theme park and resort's X account released a statement saying that the park was closed Wednesday and reopened on Thursday (May 9). \"PARK UPDATE: Due to severe thunderstorms approaching Pigeon Forge this afternoon and through the evening, Dollywood will close today (Wednesday, May 8) at 4 p.m. The park will reopen on Thursday, May 9 at 10 a.m.,\" the park said in the post on X. PARK UPDATE: Due to severe thunderstorms approaching Pigeon Forge this afternoon and through the evening, Dollywood will close today (Wednesday, May 8) at 4 p.m. The park will reopen on Thursday, May 9 at 10 a.m.â€” Dollywood Parks & Resorts (@Dollywood) May 8, 2024 ]]>A top vacation destination in the US, Dollywood is ranked six in the Top 25 Amusement Park in the United States list prepared by TripAdvisor. It is ahead of Disneyland, and two other Disney properties. Moreover, official records show that Dollywood is the biggest ticketed tourist destination in Tennessee, hosting nearly 3 million tourists in a typical season.As a result, Dollywood's closure Wednesday meant that many tourists who had pre-booked tickets to visit the park could not do so on May 8.
